source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: Tension and burst tests were conducted on irradiated Zircaloy-4 charged with hydrogen
conditions: fluence levels 7-12×10²¹ n/cm² (E>0.821 MeV); hydrogen concentrations 50-400 ppm; deformation temperatures 298-673 K

extra_properties.ductility_reduction: significant reduction in elongation compared to lower fluence/hydrogen levels
extra_properties.fracture_characteristics: evidence of ductility in fracture surfaces, localized deformation bands at higher temperatures
extra_properties.failure_mechanism: hydride-initiated fracture in dislocation channels at ~600 K

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_037_chunk2
evidence_span: Mechanical tests were conducted on irradiated Zircaloy-4. The cladding and guide tube material chemistry was consistent with ASTM Alloy Designation UNS R60804. The initial hydrogen concentration was typically less than 15 ppm. The fuel cladding was in a coldworked and stress-relief-annealed condition, while the guide tubes were in a recrystallizedannealed condition.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_037_chunk3
evidence_span: Burst properties of cladding irradiated in Fort Calhoun for four and five cycles and tested at 588 K

evidence_span: Local Hydrogen Concentration, ppm; Burst Specimen Location; Plastic Circumferential Strain

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_037_chunk3
evidence_span: cladding exhibited limited ductility, uniform strain of 0.15%, and total strain of 1.1%

evidence_span: Unirradiated; hydrogen 15 ppm; ultimate stress 414 to 483 MPa; total strain 15.00 to 20.00 nominal

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_037_chunk9
evidence_span: This paper summarizes our recent work on thin sheets, thick-walled TREXs, and thin-walled tubings of Zircaloy materials with emphasis on texture analyses
elastoplastic_model_formula: prism slip as dominant deformation mode
elastoplastic_model_data: transverse contractile strain ratios (R, P̄), formability parameter B, critical strains to necking, and fracture

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_037_chunk9
evidence_span: Constant strain-rate impression tests were used to evaluate the directional dependence of the mechanical characteristics of recrystallized Zircaloy-2 TREX
elastoplastic_model_data: mechanical anisotropy and formability parameters derived

evidence_span: Biaxial creep of cladding materials considered in terms of creep loci at constant energy dissipation for CwSR Zircaloy-4
elastoplastic_model_data: creep behavior different from recrystallized materials
